title: SAP CEO Bill McDermott steps down; shares rise
text: SAP SE SAP, -0.69% SAP, -1.09% announced late Thursday that Chief Executive Bill McDermott is stepping down effective immediately. Executive board members Jennifer Morgan and Christian Klein were appointed co-Chief Executives, the company said. McDermott was named co-CEO in 2010 and sole CEO in 2014, becoming the first American to lead the German software company. "SAP would not be what it is today without Bill McDermott," Chairman Hasso Plattner said in a statement. "Bill and I made the decision over a year ago to expand Jennifer and Christian's roles as part of a long-term process to develop them as our next generation of leaders. We are confident in their vision and capabilities as we take SAP to its next phase of growth and innovation." SAP is the largest European-based software company and the largest company in Germany by market cap. SAP's American depositary receipts rose 4% in after-hours trading, and are up 16% year to date, compared to the S&P 500's 17% gain in 2019.
